Job description:
Job Responsibilities
 Responsible to lead multiple teams of Solution Architects cross multiple sites (onshore/offshore) for technical to assist project delivery. Responsible for the overall system design, technical solution and hand-on with development team to build the system. Manages activities that take place during solution ideation, solution high/low level design and solution implementation. Identify and build standards for application & system development guidelines, best practices, application templates to ensure the rules & process are executed. Communicates with the stakeholders on architecture designs, and collaborates and coordinates with existing domain architects in the formalization and adoption of IT standards. Work with customers to understand the requirements to evaluate business requirements and eventually derive with technology solutions. Conduct technical discussions with clients to present the proposed solution design and confirm detailed technical solutions for the system. Follow up, review, and ensure the implementations are aligned with proposed solutions. Ensure solutions are not designed for a single specific purpose, but to align more closely to the standard guidelines of technology solutions.
Job Requirements
 Minimum of 10 years of experience in Solution Architect role or other information technology solutions architecture role, hands-on in system architecture & solution design. Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills. Experience in leading multiple teams of Solution Architects cross multiple sites (onshore/offshore) for technical solutioning to assist project delivery. Experience in critical mission system with multi millions of users, high load and near zero downtime and last mile delivery system. Experience in modern CI/CD pipelines and tools (e.g. Git, Jenkins, Gradle, NPM, Maven). Experience in Containers (Docker, Kubernetes, Container as a Services), Serverless (AWS Lambda) and ChatGPT technologies. Experience in Maven, Gradle, Jenkins or AWS Code Pipeline, Nexus, Git, Git Process, Nginx, Kafka and Linkerd. Experience in designing system with microservice and containerization process. Strong experience in AWS, Azure, Java Springboot, NodeJS, Postgres, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Kafka, Confluent and Saga Pattern. Hands-on experience on cloud (AWS or Azure) is mandatory. Having AWS or Azure cloud certification is preferred. Experience in Google ODRD or dispatching solution will be a good addition. Professional and consultative mindset with commitment for excellent customer service. Excellent interpersonal and English communication & presentation skills (both written and oral).

Job description:
ST Engineering is a global technology, defence and engineering group with offices across Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the U.S., serving customers in more than 100 countries. The Group uses technology and innovation to solve real-world problems and improve lives through its diverse portfolio of businesses across the aerospace, smart city, defence and public security segments.
Cyber business area An industry leader in cybersecurity with over two decades of experience, we deliver a holistic suite of trusted cybersecurity solutions to empower cyber resilience for government and ministries, critical infrastructures, and commercial enterprises. Backed by our indigenous capabilities and deep domain expertise, we offer robust cyber-secure products and services in cryptography, cybersecurity engineering, digital authentication, SCADA protection, audit and compliance. We specialise in the design and build of security operations centres for cybersecurity professionals and provide managed security services to strengthen the cybersecurity posture of our government and enterprise customers. Committed to building up competencies of cybersecurity professionals to support the growing demand, our Cybersecurity Academy has certified and trained more than 2000 cybersecurity professionals in more than 150 organisations. We continue to innovate through our Research Lab, Strategic Technology Centre, and Engineering Centres and develop future-ready cybersecurity solutions that position us at the forefront of the dynamic digital economy.
Find out more: https://www.stengg.com/cybersecurity
Cloud Security ConsultantWe are looking for an experienced Cloud Security Consultant, who design, implement and maintain cloud security solutions for cloud computing environment, in accordance with security policies, standards and best practices. You will also be responsible for researching, designing, building and managing cloud-based security products/services that help to protect and secure our clients’ cloud assets.

Promote and raise adaption of the secure cloud architecture and practices.Design, architect, review, develop and maintain a cloud architecture and cloud security solutions that protect the cloud systems which include compute, storage, network and applications.Research and understand disruptive forces on digital transformation and cloud security technology, and its impact to the cloud architecture and cloud security business strategy.Assist in the creation and delivery of cloud security services to achieve the desired business outcomes, through working closely with subject matter experts from various business areas.Consult on cloud security solutions deployed in projects to harmonize with the secure cloud architecture and identify area of improvement in the cloud architecture to accommodate immediate or future needs.Work closely with product managers, product owners and peers to support their adoption of cloud security solutions/services.Design and architect cloud security solutions for customers’ infrastructure, applications and workloads, in accordance with their business and technical requirements.Perform deployment, administration, management, configuration, testing and integration of cloud security solutions and multi-account cloud architecture, which include compute, storage, network, applications.Identify, analyze and resolve vulnerabilities and issues identified in the cloud security solutions and multi-account cloud architecture.Design, implement and maintain the DevOps tools to build a secure cloud-based orchestration platform for infrastructure as code.Design, develop and maintain the cloud security solutions for CI/CD pipelines that provide continuous integration, testing, delivery, and continuous delivery/deployment practices for agile software development

Job description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
Whole industries have been disrupted and transformed in recent years by digital technology.
As an IT advisory professional, you’ll help businesses realise the value they can gain from their IT investments — supporting strategy and being a key growth driver. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll deliver exceptional client service — providing advice on how technology enablement, digital transformation and enterprise intelligence contribute to performance improvement, as well as how IT can act as multiplying effect during major program transformations.
As organisations look to leverage the advantage IT offers, we’ll work with you to develop the consultancy and analytical skills that you’ll need in today’s environment. Working on projects that cross borders and sectors, the experiences you gain here will be more valuable than anywhere else. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.
The opportunity
We’re looking for a Senior Manager, Solutions Architect, SAP to join our rapidly expanding Technology Consulting team.
Your Key Responsibilities
Demonstrate deep knowledge of SAP solutions and appropriate industries to maintain credibility with prospective customers. Provide proof points with relevant customer stories.Support RFx completion in support of customer proposals.Engaging with Clients in understanding their requirements, scoping, discovering and defining solutions, explaining business benefits and use cases and a roadmap to meet their goals.Creating innovative solution designs that utilize our extensive service offerings.Understand client requirements (RFP/ RFI), build synopsis and have an ability to articulate the customer ask.Support the SAP implementation project and play solution architect role binding the entire solution to meet client requirementsParticipation in meetings with internal/external stakeholders (Delivery managers, Account managers and client partners) and Vertical & Horizontal teams.
To qualify for the role you must have
Prior Experience of bid and delivery solutioning as well as core delivery must in the SAPExpertise in SAP S/4 HANA and with relevant implementation experienceUnderstanding SAP S/4HANA cloud service offerings with relevant implementation experienceExperience in more than one of the functional workstream (FICO, SD, SF, EWM, TM, Ariba, Hybris, IBP) or over-all solution architectWorked on implementation RFP’s as a solution architect responsible for designing solutions end to endPrior business development experience (at least 3-4 years, overall 10-14 years) with exposure to SAP Delivery. A strong understanding of SAP and integration with other applications/systems in an IT landscapeStrong verbal and written communication with out of box thinking abilities. Ability to understand Methodologies (Activate, Agile, SDLC, SCRUM) and other industry business fundamentals and ability to showcase a quick learning curve
What We Offer
At EY, our Total Rewards package supports our commitment to creating a leading people culture - built on high-performance teaming - where everyone can achieve their potential and contribute to building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. It's one of the many reasons we repeatedly win awards for being a great place to work.
We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.
Plus, we offer
Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industryLearning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your careerThe freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Job Title: Enterprise Architect (Exp in Blueprint and Roadmap)
Job description:
Project Description:DXC Luxoft is looking for a senior enterprise architect with the vision to shape the architecture, the ability to rationalise core banking systems and the know-how to migrate to cloud, for one of our key clients in Asia. The scope spans multiple countries and the key objective is to bring diverse local architectures together into a coherent design for a reimagined enterprise. The candidate must have experience of core banking systems, shaping transformations and be able to communicate at all levels seamlessly – demanding a spectrum of skills from hands-on knowledge and capability, the ability to derive, evaluate and socialise solutions, through to management of the most senior stakeholders with the confidence to challenge the accepted.
Responsibilities:1) Act as principal Enterprise Architect to ensure that the needs of the business are met.2) Assess current state and support the CIO and Head of Architect in defining vision, strategy, interim state, target state and roadmap to come up with a single and consistent architecture for the 15 countries.3) Create and manage application and capability roadmaps, create and maintain blueprints for application architecture, conduct feasibility studies, and define technology standards.4) Identify opportunities to improve efficiency, automate processes, and reduce friction in the business.5) Help shape the future application architecture roadmaps taking account of business strategy, new and emerging technologies, and opportunities to simplify the technology landscape.6) Work closely with other IT teams to ensure that the architecture is delivered to our internal customers.7) Socialise and evangelise the architecture to the wider IT community and the business.8) Contribute to definition, operation and support of company-wide architecture governance, help grow and maintain the library of architecture assets.9) Engage with senior stakeholders across the countries in scope to define the target architecture.
Mandatory Skills Description:Degree in a computing related subject or discipline.Overall 18+ years of experience and minimum of 8 years' experience in an architecture role.Retail banking domain experience is must have. Exposure to entire banking eco- system to have a holistic view while defining target architectureCloud : Azure and experience of AWS, Google, Oracle, Alibaba or similarExperience working with senior business stakeholders.Ability to generate trust, build alliances, and orchestrate interdisciplinary teams to the benefit of business leaders using exceptional interpersonal, verbal, written and presentation skills.Have a good understanding of common architecture patterns, their benefits and their shortcomings.Demonstrable experience of conceptualising, planning, and leading implementation/adoption of off the shelf technologies.The ability to operate and communicate in both business and technical domains.

Job description:
Location

Our Senior Cloud Architect will be an integral part of our Cloud Reliability Engineering team in Singapore.

Who We Are

Public cloud transforms the way we build technology, and at DoiT International, we are on a mission to help companies, big or small, to go through this transformation.

We are a team of cloud professionals who love working with other people to solve challenging technical problems. We are committed to personal development and enjoy sharing our knowledge and experience through blogging, training, public speaking, and contributing to open-source.

We work hands-on, side-by-side with our customers to educate, mentor, advise, and solve problems to make sure they are getting the most out of what the cloud has to offer.

Our approach is different - we prefer to teach people how to fish instead of fishing for them. Here is how we do it: a day in the life of a Cloud Architect @ DoiT .

We are looking for people to join us on our mission and share the honor and delight of being able to help companies to realize their ideas into successful products.

The Opportunity

As a Senior Cloud Architect, you will be part of our global CRE team, working with rapidly growing companies in Singapore, Asia, and around the world. This role offers you the chance to:
 Apply your hands-on experience & skills in a consultative manner to address our customers’ strategic and tactical needs around cloud technologies  Grow your technical and interpersonal skills by addressing customer challenges in your daily work and leveraging dedicated time allocated by the company for learning new technologies and engaging in internal initiatives  Strengthen your personal brand through thought leadership activities such as blogging, public speaking, and participation in technology events 

Qualifications
 Good verbal and written communication skills. Besides fluent English, the ideal candidate will be comfortable conversing in Thai with our customers.  The expertise to architect, develop and troubleshoot large production-grade distributed systems on AWS and select the appropriate tools to tackle business problems at the correct scale.  Experienced with Docker and Kubernetes.  Networking experience (e.g., DNS, TCP/IP, routing, firewalls, SDN, and VPNs).  A programming background with shell scripts and one or more of the following: JavaScript, Java, Python, GO or Rust. About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
High Level Description

Technical Consultant will be responsible for providing solution guidance and support for projects and proposals. During project, the technical consultant would need to work with client’s IT and Security team to ensure compliance and develop technical documentations.

Responsibilities

Define the functional/business capabilities that need to be implemented to operationalize the business imperatives.

Provide FluentCommerce technical expertise and solution support to Functional Consultant and clients IT and Security team throughout the project lifecycle

Drive solution design sessions to define the configurations and customizations along with architecture and integration based on best practices with Fluent Commerce platform

Perform estimation effort to shape delivery plans and proposals

Deliver Enablement Training

IBM Sterling

Magento

Blue yonder

Manhattan Associates

Oracle Transport Management

Team player mindset with excellent communication & interpersonal skills

We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

Job description:
Company Description
For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose-built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,900 companies and have detected 100 Million threats/day.
We work in a fast-paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrives on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.
Traditional security companies are becoming less relevant as cloud adoption and digital transformation become the norm in every market industry and in every market segmentation. Zscaler has been a leader in Gartner’s MQ for 10 consecutive years and has helped shape the emerging SASE category (a true category creator). We are well positioned to dominate this massively growing cloud security market.
Job Description
A Zscaler Transformation Architect is a Director level role and an industry expert who advises, encourages, and challenges customers and prospects to evolve their cybersecurity architecture from one based on legacy Network and Perimeter architectures to one based on Zero Trust Architecture design principles leveraging the Zscaler Zero Trust Exchange (ZTE).
As a leader of Transformation Architects, you will bring the right mix of technical, sales, and business acumen delivered with empathy and creative problem-solving.
The Transformation Architect organization connects with many stakeholders, requiring that our teams lead and engage sideways within the hierarchy, not just up and down.
The ideal candidate will have a similar background to that of Transformation Architects but with the additional abilities required to be a formal people leader, a coach/mentor to those around you, and a trusted advisor to senior leadership.
More information on the team(s) you will lead is below. Their success is your success.
Zscaler Transformation Architects help our customers Secure, Simplify and Transform. Examples of related topics are…
Security & Network TransformationApplication and Infrastructure Modernization The Modern Workplace with hybrid working
The Transformation Architect is primarily a pre-sales role that will facilitate consultative discovery and design workshops meant to uncover a customer’s business requirements and their current state architecture. The information uncovered is used to design a high-level Zero Trust Architecture including a phased adoption roadmap expressing how the customer can transform to a Zero Trust Architecture future state over time.
The Transformation Architect needs to engage across customer functional teams, as well as Zscaler partner and internal teams, to develop rapport and to ensure success. Interactions will range across the customer organizational structure from customer engineer to customer executive.
These efforts require a collaborative, seasoned industry professional who can code-switch seamlessly between CXO and IT Operations audiences. The candidate should convey and be able to balance a combination of executive presence and deep technical credibility. The ability to adopt a confident, yet consultative customer-facing persona is key. Think of “executive presence” plus humility.
Qualifications
Successful candidates typically have 15+ years of relevant industry experience, or 10+ years of experience and an advanced degree in domains such as Networking and Cybersecurity, and hold or have held advanced relevant industry certifications.
A successful Transformation Architect…
Is a Technology Evangelist who understands the competitive landscapes, industry trends and dynamics as they relate to Zscaler’s value proposition.Possesses a strong business acumen, can think on their feet and are able to pivot and control the conversation during meetings to achieve desired outcomes.Possesses excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to make the complex simple.Is self-aware, effectively balances their qualities of IQ, EQ, SQ and AQ appropriately. Maintains advanced product expertise and solution development capability, delivering on advanced solution selling.Understands end-to-end Enterprise Architectures with an extensive understanding of complex Networking and Security environments. Additional Cloud expertise and knowledge of other adjacent domains is a plus.Has hands-on experience with various technologies including TCP/IP protocol stack, DNS, BGP routing, MPLS, SD-WAN, GRE, IPsec, Layer-7 firewalls, Web Proxies, Load Balancing and Data Loss Prevention among others.Is well versed in NIST Zero Trust Architecture, is familiar with applicable laws, regulations, industry standards, and best practices, including GxP, GDPR, HIPAA, PCI, ISO 27001, NIST CSF, MITRE ATT&CK, Cyber Kill Chain, CISA.Assists with educating, influencing, mentoring and coaching activities within the team and across the organization.Adopts a coach / mentor mindset, sharing both technical and sales experience to up-level our collective team through on the job training, enablement and collaboration.Provides senior thought leadership. Internally - Influencing the organization and company direction. Externally - Using customer / partner facing venues (events, social media, etc.) to influence industry direction.
Additional Information
Why Zscaler?
People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.
Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ: ZS ) is available at https://www.zscaler.com.
Zscaler is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy or related medical conditions), age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Job Title: Technical Solution Architect, Webex Customer Experience (Contact Center & CPaaS)
Industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing:Software Development:Computer Networking Products
Job description:
What You’ll Do
As a Webex Customer Experience Technical Solutions Architect (TSA), your primary responsibility is to provide technical guidance and presales engineering support for Customer Experience (CX) sales pursuits across an assigned territory.
Key Responsibilities:
Key collaborator and technical contributor on a stellar team of Technical Solutions ArchitectsSupport a matrix of CX Sales Specialists and General Account teams with direct opportunity support, business development, and partner mentoring and development. Promote the business and technical value of the Webex Customer Experience portfolio including CCaaS, CPaaS, WFO and the broader Cisco Collaboration suite of offerings. Perform technical discovery, requirements gathering, and architectural and application solution design to show customers how Cisco Webex technologies can automate and simplify complex business processes. Design and present solutions and impactful demonstrations to customer stakeholders, focusing on the impact of the business outcome and not necessarily the underlying technologiesEncourage partners to adopt, sell and build competency deploying Webex CX technologies. Help partner technical sales teams design innovative architectural solutions that drive strategic objectives and help differentiate partner offerings. Build trusted technical advisor relationships with Customers and leaders of various partner groups, linking the Cisco Webex vision to relevant business strategies. Embrace the use of opportunity management tools such as SFDC to navigate the sales lifecycle leveraging relevant Cisco Webex enablement programs to drive pipeline and track sales activities. Ability to articulate the business value of the Cisco Webex Customer Experience portfolio to both technical and non-technical audiencesFor technical audiences, ensure the architectural impact of Cisco Webex technology in system designs and proposals is understood, valued and technically sound. Occasional travel will be required when deemed safe and approved. Examples include visiting customer sites to present solutions and build trusted advisor relationships, escorting customers to sales briefings, attending industry conferences and trade shows, and attending Cisco corporate events. 
Who You’ll Work With:
In this role you will partner with a team of Customer Experience (CX) and Collaboration Sales Specialists, as well as a matrix of Account Manager and Systems Architect teams for specific customers. As a technical representative for the Customer Experience portfolio, you will work closely with Product Teams, Global Collaboration Sales Teams, and attend and/or present at internal and industry-facing events such as Cisco Live, Enterprise Connect, Impact, SEVT, and Webex One.
Who You Are
:
An excellent communicator with strong presentation and demonstration skillsDeep technical acumen and foundational knowledge of Contact Center and/or other cloud-based communication technologies10 years validated experience in the Contact Center fieldAt least 4 years of Consulting or Pre-Sales Engineering experienceA university degree in a technical discipline or equivalent professional experiencePossess a growth mindset and thrive in an environment of continuous education and product evolution Intimate knowledge of business and technical trends in the Customer Care industry and love to share insights with teammates, customers, and partnersYou prioritize teamwork, personal and professional growth, and organizational developmentYou are autonomous, great with time and calendar management, enjoy a fast-paced environment, and are comfortable with changeDetail oriented and always follow-upDriven to achieve, creatively using internal and external resources to drive winning outcomesPrior presales or delivery experience with CC, CCaaS, and/or CPaaS platforms is preferredKnowledge of programmability concepts such as RESTful APIs, SDKs, JavaScript and JSON is an advantageKnowledge of Cisco Internetworking technologies is beneficial
Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters – with people like you!

Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data traveling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and sizes to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5G, or otherwise.

We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).

We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

ASM is a leading global supplier of products, services, and materials for semiconductor processing. For more than half a century, innovation has been at the core of everything we do. Our smart, ambitious people are dedicated to creating cutting-edge solutions for the world’s leading semiconductor providers. Every day we push the development of next-generation computer-chip technology, always staying a few steps ahead of what’s next.

The talented, enthusiastic people at ASM are just like you: dedicated to improving people’s lives and unlocking new potential. With our collaborative approach to R&D, we advance key semiconductor technologies and platforms like ALD, epitaxy, PEALD, PECVD, and vertical furnaces. And we have recently entered the promising high-growth market: silicon carbide epitaxy. Year after year, our innovations help to make chips smaller, faster, and more powerful. In fact, you will find our technology in every aspect of modern life: in AI, medical equipment, 5G, smartphones, autonomous driving, and more.

As an Application Architect Manager - Finance, you will be responsible for overseeing the design, development, and implementation of financial software applications and solutions. Your expertise will drive the strategic planning and optimization of financial system ensuring seamless integration with our organization's technology infrastructure

Responsibilities

Job Title: Senior Consultant / Manager, Enterprise Architect, Technology Consulting
Job description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
Whole industries have been disrupted and transformed in recent years by digital technology.
As a Technology Consulting professional, you’ll help businesses realise the value they can gain from their IT investments — supporting strategy and being a key growth driver. As part of a high-performing team, you’ll deliver exceptional client service — providing advice on how technology enablement, digital transformation and enterprise intelligence contribute to performance improvement, as well as how IT can act as multiplying effect during major program transformations.
 
As organisations look to leverage the advantage IT offers, we’ll work with you to develop the consultancy and analytical skills that you’ll need in today’s environment. Working on projects that cross borders and sectors, the experiences you gain here will be more valuable than anywhere else. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.
 
About The Opportunity
We’re looking for Senior Consultants/Managers for Technology Consulting to join our team with experience in one or more of the following:
Enterprise Architecture
Key Responsibilities:
The Enterprise Architect works closely with portfolio leaders to develop product strategies, Technology roadmaps, establish new standards and develop target architectures.Leverage the business demands to provide architecture guidance based on market study and customer/employee experiences. Lead digital product planning, vendor roadmap sessions and provide disciplined architecture leadership.
To qualify for the role, you must have
Experience in building a strategic roadmap Experience in building technology roadmapMinimum 6 years’ experience in a Senior Architect or an Enterprise Architect role
Ideally, you’ll also have
Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, presentation, client service and business writing and consulting skills, coupled with a strong interest in further designing, developing and integrating business operations and technologyAbility to research client inquiries and emerging issuesA dedication to teamwork and integrity within a professional environmentCertification in TOGAF, Azure, CITA or O365
What We Look For
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.
What Working At EY Offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
Skills: Product Planning:Strategic Roadmaps:Technology Consulting

Job Title: Director, Solutions Architecture, Prisma Cloud, Japan & Asia Pacific
Job description:
Your CareerAs the Solution Architecture (SA) Director for Prisma Cloud, you will lead the JAPAC cloud security engineering technical sales team, focusing on premier customer accounts.This role involves guiding senior SA managers to unlock their full potential and delivering distinct solution validation for the most significant and strategic opportunities.Leading and operating in this dynamic and ever-changing environment necessitates a visionary leader who thrives on the tremendous potential of succeeding with the market-leading CNAPP solution, Prisma Cloud.A fundamental objective for this role is translating customer outcomes into fully operationalized Prisma Cloud architecture and deployment. These customers are globally recognized brands, making them prime targets for substantial cyber threats that demand world-class cloud security protection. Operationalizing solutions here equates to world-class security for these customers.Leveraging your expertise, you will guide and mentor field SA Managers (SAMs) in coaching and cultivating a team of cloud security engineers dedicated to safeguarding critical infrastructure and revenue-generating workloads for Fortune 1000 accounts.To help customers navigate the escalating threat landscape and the growing intricacies of cloud security, this leader must elevate the SAMs to deliver CTO-level expertise and thought leadership.Your responsibility includes driving high Prisma Cloud adoption by orchestrating collaboration among key stakeholders to ensure optimal platform module utilization based on architectures aligned with best practices. Additionally, the SA organization should assist customers in engineering and optimizing their Prisma Cloud solutions based on recommendations and best practices.We're in search of a leader with a zeal for formulating strategies, fostering leadership teams, and scaling businesses.Your ImpactInfluence the cloud security perspective of CIOs, CTOs, CISOs, and DevOps leaders, shaping their long-term architectural directions and roadmap scopes to attain target end-states.Lead discussions about industry trends and emerging shifts in the cloud security landscape that customers need to anticipate.Mentor, coach, and nurture your team, ensuring their engagement and success in their careers.Expand the SA organization by recruiting, mentoring, and inspiring SAs and SAMs to deliver their finest work.Collaborate closely with global sales leadership to direct the GTM strategy.Safeguard our dynamic "start-up" energy as we scale.Comprehend the strengths and weaknesses of leading products in the market, positioning Prisma Cloud as a distinctive offering.Champion the voice of users and customers, influencing product direction and feature priorities.Foster a positive outlook, a can-do attitude, and a growth mindset, serving as a role model while leading and maintaining the motivation of SAs in a fast-paced environment.

Qualifications

Minimum ExperienceHold a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.Possess a track record of managing and building teams of presales engineers, overseeing team in cloud engineering and/or cloud securityBring hands-on experience in technical sales engineering within a cloud computing environment or equivalent customer-facing technical engineering roles.Preferred ExperienceHold an MBA or Master's degree in Computer Science.Profound industry knowledge encompassing security product market trends, coupled with understanding of technology roadmap and advancements, as well as competitorofferingsDemonstrate proficiency in selling cloud-native security to C-Suite of companies, particularly in the Japan & Asia Pacific region.Domain expertise spanning public cloud architectures, cloud-native security models, CI/CD, DevOps, firewalls, and various security technologies, from both technological and business perspectivesShowcase knowledge of solution architecture within public cloud environments.Adaptability to grasp, comprehend, and work with emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions within the Cloud Security realm.

Additional Information

The TeamJoin our Systems Engineering team, where your technical prowess empowers our sales team and cultivates trust with key clients. At Palo Alto Networks, your success is paramount, and our collective commitment ensures your growth in solution selling, learning, and development. As a part of our systems engineering team, you'll thrive in a solution-oriented sales environment, finding fulfillment in tackling intricate cyber threats alongside our clients.Our CommitmentWe are pioneers who dream big, take daring steps, and challenge the norm in cybersecurity. Our strength lies in our diverse teams, innovating collectively.We are dedicated to making reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. Should you require assistance or accommodation due to disability or special needs, reach out to us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity is our hallmark, and every qualified applicant will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected attributes.Rest assured, all your information will be handled confidentially in accordance with EEO guidelines.

Job description:
At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.

Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.

 Be a Part of Something BIG! 

Singtel are at the leading edge of technology development to improve the experience of our customers as they consume services across mobile, voice and data infrastructure, managed services, cloud computing, IT services and professional consulting. To support that journey, we are searching for top talent and have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Architect to strengthen our team.

This is a strategic role expected to focus on Application Architecture for various digital channels and platforms.

Apply now , and ignite our digital future together.

 Make an Impact  by 
 Understands business functions and transform requirements into architecture and blueprint for the solution being created. Need to propose new innovative solutions, updates to existing solutions, negotiate alternative options, build technical and release roadmaps  End to end architecture responsibility of at least one platform. Also, responsible for EA activities for that platform, such as reference architecture, roadmap etc.  Provide thought leadership to the broader team with respect to the responsible platform(s).  Construct a solution architecture around Microservices and APIs, and be able to decompose monolith applications into meaningful implementable Microservices and APIs in a Cloud/DevOps environment  Work closely with the development team and get their buy-in into accepting the design to be implemented. Also, work with different stake holders, product owner, senior executives, external parties like system integrators, product partners.  Provide technology perspective to business to achieve roadmap and prioritization by keeping abreast with industry trends. Where required, help business size the complexity of problem and help simplify and define MVP  Provide fit for purpose solutions to customer business needs/issues.  Craft architecture that is aligned to the reference architecture, meeting budget and timelines  Clear, precise, and understandable communication with stakeholders  Actively engaging with customers, stakeholders, and co-workers with a good interpersonal skill  Able to create reference architecture and roadmaps aligning with biz and technology stakeholders  Effectively collaborate with other co-worker and architect across domain  Motivate and align team members to achieve the goal, effective leadership skills  Ownership of e2e architecture for one/many platform(s) 

Skills For Success
 Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or its Equivalent  14+ years of experience in the technology industry including 8+ in architecture of scalable and high-performance internet facing systems  Possess strong background and experience as a successful Software engineer/Architect in building large scale, highly available Internet and mobile applications.  Have in depth knowledge of cloud computing, microservices architecture (incl. design pattern, rest/grpc, gateway & service mesh etc.), DevOps, Streaming architecture, Modern data architecture, Mobile and Web application architecture  Good experience in API security including OAuth2/OIDC, Tokens, mTLS etc.  Significant experience working on mission critical internet facing applications focusing on scalability, performance, architecture aspects 

 Rewards that Go Beyond 
 Hybrid work arrangements  Full suite of health and wellness benefits  Ongoing training and development programs  Internal mobility opportunities 

 Your Career Growth Starts Here. Apply Now! 

 We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

Job description:
About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.
Accenture is an Irish-domiciled multinational professional services company that provides services in:

 Technology

 Strategy & Consulting

 Interactive

 Operations

As a Fortune Global 500 company, it has been incorporated in Dublin, Ireland since September 1, 2009. In 2019, the company reported revenues of $43.2 billion, with more than 492,000 employees serving clients in more than 200 cities in 120 countries.
Accenture Technology combines business and industry insights with innovative technology services to transform your business. Join one of the world’s largest independent providers of technology services to grow your expertise and help clients worldwide to innovate at scale and transform their businesses. Help change how the world works and lives through technology innovation.
Key responsibilities include:

Focuses on key Data and AI deals and accounts for opportunity origination, qualification, and solution architecture.

Skilled in pre-sales, and engages clients including CxOs, Client Account Leaders/account teams to comprehensively explain relevance of AMBG solutions to client's needs.

Plays the role of a trusted-advisor to our Client Account Leaders/account teams and clients providing thought leadership, explain relevance of technology offerings and services and explain use-cases that are relevant to meeting the client's business needs.

Is a subject matter expert, with significant past architecture, design and implementation experience in large scale enterprise environment

Implement solutions visualizing, and designing an organization's data management framework

Articulates the value of AMBG horizontal plays, industry aligned and functional solution areas.

Minimum of 10 years of Data Engineering and Migration experience in one or more of the following areas (individual areas or combined experience): Cloud Data Modernization, Data Engineering, Data Platforms, Data Integration, Data Migration, Data Governance, Data Strategy, Data Architecture, Master Data Management, Data Modeling,

Has strong solution architecture experience in large complex data management programs

Minimally 6 years of strong pre-sales/sales experience with end-to-end solutioning accountability

Strong knowledge and solutioning experience in Azure is preferred - Microsoft Azure Architecture, DevOps, ETL, Datawarehouse, Datalake architectures, Database platforms such as SQL, MS-SQL, Postgresql etc., legacy data system migration to cloud.

Broad experience across a variety of data stores (e. g., HDFS, Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Blob Storage, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Apache HBase, Azure DocumentDB), messaging systems (e.g., Apache Kafka, Azure Event Hubs, Azure IoT Hub) and data processing engines (e. g., Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Apache Storm, Azure HDInsight).

Has at least industry experience with in at least one sectors: Products / Retail, FS, Public Sector

Strong stakeholder and client management skills and experience

Strong analytical, interpersonal and collaboration skills

Good written and communication skills

All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.
Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
Looking forward to hear from you soon! Have a great day ahead.

Job description:
[What the role is]
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) is the lead agency driving Singapore’s Smart Nation initiatives and public sector digital transformation. As the Centre of Excellence for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems (ICT & SS), GovTech develops the Singapore Government’s capabilities in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, Application Development, Smart City Technology, Digital Infrastructure, and Cybersecurity.
At GovTech, we offer you a purposeful career to make lives better. We empower our people to master their craft through continuous and robust learning and development opportunities all year round. Our GovTechies embody our Agile, Bold and Collaborative values to deliver impactful solutions.
GovTech aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do.
Play a part in Singapore’s vision to build a Smart Nation and embark on your meaningful journey to build tech for public good. Join us to advance our mission and shape your future with us today!
Learn more about GovTech at tech.gov.sg.
How we work: 
We are seeking a Principal Infrastructure Architect with deep technical expertise across one or more infrastructure domains, good depth of knowledge of best practices (e.g. infrastructure automation) and technologies, and with experience in deploying cloud infrastructure for applications. This senior role calls for passionate individuals who loves solutioning and relishes the opportunity to create innovative application infrastructure answers to solve real-world problems, resulting in a more secure, robust, resilient, and high-performance IT infrastructure architecture and operations. The role will also lead the rest of government agencies’ infra teams in the adoption of cloud infrastructure for existing and new applications.
What you will be working on: 
Provide subject matter expertise around the area of application infrastructure and cloud computing. Domains include server, storage, network, security, and operations/governance.Provide leadership to other Infrastructure Architects, Engineers and Managers in GovTech managed agencies to support the design of application infrastructure architecture and integration patterns, resource planning, system and application performance management practices and overall infrastructure operating environment for one or more private or public cloud computing platform.Exhibit deep understanding in the technology domains of cloud technology and collaborate closely with other architects (information/data, application, solution, and enterprise) to jointly develop blueprints, reference architectures, tools and overall solutions for all government agencies.Be conversant with Application Infrastructure/Technical Architecture and Infrastructure Governance Processes in ensuring smooth and sustainable IT Operations and management (including both security and resiliency) across the whole-of-government.
What we are looking for: 
Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or InformationTechnology or equivalentMinimum 10 years of proven track record of having application infrastructure architecture capabilities in the domain of on-premise and cloud computing (either private cloud utilizing virtualization technology or commercial cloud technologies).Advanced Certification in one or more Cloud Technology platform (either in Architecture, Network/Security and/or DevOps), will be preferred.Demonstrate both deep and broad level of technical expertise in one or more areas of Infrastructure Architecture and Operation Management concepts, Infrastructure Network and Security, Cloud Computing and DevOps Engineering concepts.Must be passionate, proactive and willing to act as a guide or mentor to larger community.Have excellent verbal and written communication skill, with the ability to present ideas and influence stakeholders at senior levels.Passion and belief in GovTech core values – Agile, Bold and Collaborative.
GovTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive workplace that values diverse voices and perspectives, as we believe that diversity is the foundation to innovation.
Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. These include leave benefits to meet your work-life needs and employee wellness programmes.
We champion flexible work arrangements (subject to your job role) and trust that you will manage your own time to deliver your best, wherever you are, and whatever works best for you.
Learn more about life inside GovTech at go.gov.sg/GovTechCareers.
Stay connected with us on social media at go.gov.sg/ConnectWithGovTech.
Skills: Cloud Computing:Communication:DevOps:Electronic Engineering:High Availability (HA):IT Operations:Passionate about Work:Private Clouds:Technical Architecture:Virtualization

Job description:
Aiven is a trusted open source data platform for everyone. We are a cast of over 400 ‘Crabs’ with a passion for open-source and a cutting edge tech stack. We take ownership of the problems we solve and act with courage. Openness is our beating heart.
It takes an uncommon person to contribute to the common good. Would you like to join our Cast where everyone at every level works side-by-side on making developers’ lives better, and letting them build what matters most?
Aiven in a crabshell:
Our platform delivers reliable and secure data opsGlobal service footprint & support organizationSecurity is central to us500+ customers in 60+ countries$420M in VC fundingOur Burrow in Helsinki and hubs in Berlin, Boston, Paris, Singapore, Sydney, Toronto and Tokyo, remote team members employees from all over the world.
We value and celebrate the diversity of our people. We strive every day to build an inclusive workplace where all of us can thrive. We have a journey ahead of us, and we are committed to taking that journey towards being a more diverse and inclusive company.
Come and read more about us at https://aiven.io/blog/what-is-aiven.
The Role:
As a Manager of a Solutions Architect (SA) team, you will be responsible for all aspects of building and managing a team of hard-working SA’s. Ensuring your team delivers efficiently as part of each customers ‘Account Team’ via attentive operational focus, capability development, and alignment with key partners in Customer Success, Sales, Support and Engineering.
Ensuring the engagement, success, retention and growth of our customers through the powerful impact of your team's advice and guidance on the most optimized technical and financial setup, with the measures being NRR and QoQ revenue growth.
What You'll Do
For your team:
Attract, recruit, ramp and mentor a team of great Solutions Architects from a diverse group of backgrounds and experiencesAct as a player/coach to get the best out of your team with a servant based leadership approach. Adopting mentoring mentality will be critical here, ensuring that you balance your field responsibilities, including handling customer concerns, cultivating team members, and building a career path for your solution architects.Drive standardisation and consistency by guiding your team to document and maintain accurate and timely customer technical information in internal systemsCarefully balancing the workload on your team, the requirements of the customer and Aiven
For your customers (through your team):
Understanding your key customers’ strategies for adoption of Aiven technologies and helping them achieve their business objectives through technical outcomesEnsure that your customers’ requirements are being met with our services through partnership with Product Management, Production Engineering, helping to advocate for your regions customers whilst aligning to the goals and priorities of Aiven’s roadmapExecutive sponsorship of key accounts in the region, being an inspiring leader/partner to your customers and the company within EMEAProvide recommendations on capacity planning, disaster recovery, best cloud and service approaches as well as advising on how to gain the best value from Aiven.Build technical and business relationships with the customer
For internal teams:
Create a positive morale for the team and help cultivate a working relationship between various internal partners to achieve regional quota targets, Company-wide goals and ensure long term customer relationships are builtInterpret complex problems – technical/process/people/customer, create simple solutions and collaborate closely with internal teams to deliver winning solutionsDirect the bulk of your day to day work based on guidance and goals from leadership, leading the planning, actions and outcomes of the regionPartner with the EMEA leadership team on customer programs, marketing initiatives and community/company events to drive adoption and expansion and advocacy within our customer baseContribute customer insights to enable internals teams to resolve incidents for customers
Consulting Skills
Understand customers’ technical requirements on an architectural level and propose solutions to address them using Aiven’s servicesAbility to communicate complex technical concepts in an approachable manner and with the correct technical level for the audienceAbility to implement software solutions as needed in a post-sales capacity to collaborate with Aiven services in order to address business requirementsAbility to form deep technical relationships with customers' technical staff
Technical Skills
Some experience managing a team, 5-10 years in the high tech industry having held roles such as Developer, Architect, Sales Engineer/Architect, Manager, etc.Knowledgeable of public clouds (AWS, Google or Azure) and in the areas of compute, storage - block and object, networking, and security groupsDeep understanding of at least one of Aiven services and experience using others.Proven use of a relational database, preferably PostgreSQL and/or MySQLBeing a technical subject matter expert on Aiven's service offerings
Required qualifications:
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or similar field) or, an equivalent amount of professional experience in software engineering
The following are nice to have:
Writing technical blogs and conducting webinarsExperience working in technology/software sales, post-sales or consultingGiving talks at conferences and meetupsCustomer relationship management
What We're Looking For:
Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up flawlessly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
Our Offer
If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
We invest in you
Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.Dreaming of flexible work arrangements? Look no further. Work in one of our hubs, fully remote, or anything in between.Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).Get holistic wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.
Make a difference at Aiven
Contribute to open source projects that you find meaningful outside of work - and get paid for it! Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.
What else?
Looking after your future: we adhere to the Central Provident Fund.Don’t lose out on time off - any public holiday that falls on a Saturday is are granted back to you in lieu.Need insurance? We’ve got you covered - benefit from our: Private Health Insurance and Life Insurance.
Amazing! What’s next?
If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV and we’ll get in touch.
How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams
There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
Equal Opportunities
Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
At Aiven we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
Skills: Customer Success:Defining Requirements:Executive Sponsorship:Post-Sales:Software Implementation:Software Solutions:Solution Architecture:Technical Requirements:Technical Subject Matter:Work Hardening

Job Title: Lead, IT Infrastructure Solutions and Architecture
Job description:
Job Purpose
The individual will provide leadership to the IT Infrastructure capability of Great Eastern. The individual will be part of the core team that will drive the IT Infrastructure strategy and execution for traditional, cloud, and hybrid environments. The individual will provide IT Infrastructure architecture, designs and solution. The individual may also lead implementation project and delivery innovative capabilities. The individual will continuously maintain and strive to improvement upon the service level and quality of services provide by IT Infrastructure function by introducing technology and processes which improve operational efficiency and effectiveness thru automation and orchestration, improve stability and availability thru monitoring, and implementation of resilient and robust designs.
The Job
 Lead as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the development to infrastructure strategy, solution and architectures and supporting tools for traditional, cloud and hybrid environments for any one area or more of network, compute, database and storage which align with Business / IT strategy. Create architecture artefact and documents such as infrastructure architecture blueprint, AND infrastructure design for future state infrastructure architecture to effective explain architect design concepts and solutions to various levels of stakeholders which are align to best practices, operational ease, resiliency, availability, and performance. Develop infrastructure solutions to meet application needs. Develop implementation roadmaps and lead projects/initiatives to bring about improvements to the IT Infrastructure capabilities which may include integration of new technology / cloud architecture into existing infrastructure Lead continuous enhancement and exploratory work to design, developer and deploy new infrastructure and supporting tools for traditional and cloud environments Provide team leadership, covering training and development needs, appraisals and performance management. Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.
Our Requirements
 A Bachelor’s degree or Professional Degree in Computer Science / IT or equivalent At least 12 years of relevant experience in managing IT Infrastructure, with at least 4 in infrastructure solution and architecture. Strategic thinking approach in developing innovative infrastructure design that meets business requirements Experience and knowledgeable in traditional and cloud architectures and technologies for network, servers, database, storage, middleware Familiar with IT security technologies and solutions Familiarity with tools such as CA UIM, Solarwind, MF SA/NA, Ansible, and ServiceNow would be advantages Familiarity with concept such as Infrastructure as Code, and DevSecOps Planning and organisational skills for undertaking team leadership and BAU workload management. Self-driven with a positive attitude and strong leadership skills to champion for culture change management initiatives within IT and with interfacing Business stakeholders Strong and factual communication skills and able to manage situations/conflicts and influence others, ability to communicate IT Infrastructure Architecture methods, concepts, standards and practices. Good analytical skills and a creative approach to problem solving. Team player who can lead in brainstorm session with peers to problem solve and make decisions. Good understanding of apply risk management techniques and its application Experience working with multiple internal and external teams (business and IT) Understanding of various Software Development Lifecycle and Project Management PMO, ITIL, and TOGAF certification, or equivalent, is an added advantage Ability to understand business processes and financial functions are a plus High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork. Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.
About Great Eastern
Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner.
We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us.
We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions.
Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people’s lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management.
To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job description:
Purpose of the Job
 
You will be reporting to the Head of IT, this role is key to driving forward data change in the organisation, making data accessible and visible and working closely with business stakeholders in order to enable data driven decisions at the senior level. You are not just doing data reporting but would be required to build a Data Warehouse in a Greenfield environment. You will work with the Head of IT to drive data strategy and liaise closely with key business stakeholders to deliver data projects. Your role will focus on analysing, modelling, building and connecting data to support and drive continued visualisation and analytics across the business. It will include the production of analytical dashboards, supporting the major fleet IT data projects and supporting the build and connectivity of data platforms. This role requires a strong business focus with the ability to deliver continuous value. This is a senior individual contributor position where you will start and build concept analysis, place together Architecture and eventually expand into your own team. 
 
This role comes with budget responsibilities and a data analyst.
 
This is an exciting opportunity to be part of driving forward the digitalisation strategy which includes cloud, fleet and data transformation programs. 
 
 
Job Accountabilities/Key Responsibilities:

Work with the Head of IT to continue to drive data strategy and build data awareness.Partner with key business stakeholders to deliver reporting and dashboard solutions.Drive the build and delivery of a data warehouse and/or a data lake platformUtilize BI and analytical tools to visualize data effectively and analyze and present results in a clear and concise manner.Work with the technical team to contribute to the delivery of Fleet IT data projectsDefine and identify gaps between current challenges and future business needs.Deliver data analytics and predictive models where appropriate.Partner with the commercial operations team to support and drive improvements in their commercial platform and reporting outcomes. 
The ideal candidate is pro-active, conceptual and a self-starter. You will be able to manage multiple stakeholders including vendors, internal system owner, senior stakeholders, head of business and end users. You will be able to advise direction and drive improvements forward as well as manage existing expectations. You should be able to visualize the end-to-end business process clearly in mind based on users’ requirement so as to present a feasible solution. You possess a positive working attitude and have proven ability working in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment.

 
Qualifications & Experience:
 
BSc in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsOver 10 years practical experience in data design, build and visualization.Proven working experience as a Data ArchitectProven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data AnalystProven experience working closely with business stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver outcomes.You will have a broad background and depth in data for a number of years.Technical expertise regarding data models, database design and development, data warehouse design, data lakes, data mining and segmentation techniques.Experience building a data warehouse (MANDATE)Knowledge of modern data architecture using data lakes would be an advantage.Good and deep understanding of design, kick off and data modeling skills (MANDATE).Proven experience in producing visualisations and dashboards for business stakeholders.Strong knowledge of and experience with PowerBI and other visualization tools such as Qliksense, Tableau, Cognos, etc.; databases (MSSQL, Oracle etc); programming (SQL, Python, Java, R, JSON)Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findingsKnowledge of commercial shipping systems such as IMOS would be an advantage.In-house data warehouse and data experiences are preferred.   
 
Desired Skills & Competencies:
 
Leading & Deciding

Takes control and exercises leadershipInitiates action, gives direction and takes responsibility

Interacting & Presenting 
 
Communicates and networks effectivelySuccessfully persuade and influences othersRelates to others in a confident and relaxed manner 

Analysing & Interpreting
Shows evidence of clear analytical thinkingGets to the heart of complex problems and issuesApplies own expertise effectivelyQuickly learns new technologyCommunicates well in writing

Creating & Conceptualising

Open to new ideas and experiencesSeeks out learning opportunitiesHandles situations and problems with innovation and creativityThinks broadly and strategicallySupports and drives organisational change

Organising & Executing

Plans ahead and works in a sytematic and organised wayFollows directions and proceduresFocuses on customer satisfaction and delivers quality service to the agreed standards 
 
Desired Values:

IntegrityResponsibilityCustomer FocusQualityResponsivenessInnovationTeamwork

Senior managers and executives across the business
